alert.note: Alert for Steuben (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 1:34PM EST until March 07 at 6:15PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following county, Steuben. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 132 PM EST, emergency management reported flooding in areas of poor drainage due to heavy rain in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen with additional heavy rain falling in the headwaters. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Michigan Creek, Catherine Creek, North Branch Glendening Creek, Talbot Creek, Elk Creek, Lime Kiln Creek, Goodhue Creek, Colonel Bills Creek, Curtis Creek, Tioga River, South Branch Tuscarora Creek, Gravel Run, Helmer Creek, North Branch Tuscarora Creek, Tracy Creek, Dennis Creek, Stocking Creek, Campbell Creek and Tuscarora Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Addison, Woodhull, Jasper, Cameron, West Cameron, Cameron Mills, Risingville and Pinnacle State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
